content:
• Friday, June 8, 2018
  • CRON

    After Hours Gainers / Losers (06/08/2018)

    • Top gainers: CRON +2.3%. LGCY +1.9%. TISI +1.7%. NCSM +1.5%. BCOV +1.5%.
    • Top Losers: FANH -7.7%. ACRS -3.2%.  LTM -3.2%. FRAN -3.0%. PAGS -2.8%.

  • WEB

    Web.com +5% as Starboard Value discloses 9.4% stake

    • Web.com Group (NASDAQ:WEB) is up 5% postmarket with a 13D filing showing a 9.4% stake taken by Starboard Value.
    • The investment manager through affiliated funds is beneficial owner of 4,630,579 shares, according to the filing.
    • Purchases took place throughout May and June to date.
    • Since May 2, when the filing notes purchasing began, shares of Web.com are up 8.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:34 PM
  • IBIO

    IBio completes 1:10 reverse split

    • Nano cap iBio (NYSEMKT:IBIO) has completed its previously announced 1:10 reverse split of its common stock. Post-split trading will commence in Monday, June 11.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM | 2 Comments
  • SYNA

    Synaptics closes day +10.8%, previously declined Dialog's $59/share bid

    • Synaptics (NASDAQ:SYNA) closed today’s wild ride up 10.8% on reports the company is in deal talks with Dialog Semiconductor (OTCPK:DLGNF).
    • A CNBC source says Synaptics rejected Dialog’s initial offer of $59/share in cash, which was offered in March.  
    • Previously: Update: Synaptics +2% on potential Dialog Semi deal (June 8)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM | 5 Comments
  • AEMD

    Aethlon Medical beats by $0.02

    • Aethlon Medical (NASDAQ:AEMD): FY EPS of -$0.46 beats by $0.02.
    • Revenue of $0.15M (-61.5% Y/Y)
    • Shares +2.31%.
    • Press Release

  • EGRX

    Court awards Orphan Drug exclusivity for Eagle Pharma's Bendeka; shares up 6%

    • Thinly traded Eagle Pharmaceuticals (EGRX +6.1%) finished the session in the green on more than double normal on the news that a judge ruled in its favor regarding seven years of U.S. market exclusivity for blood cancer drug Bendeka (bendamustine hydrochloride).
    • The company sued the FDA in 2016 after it rejected Orphan Drug-related exclusivity citing the lack of evidence of clinical superiority.
    • Previously: FDA rejects Eagle Pharma's market exclusivity request for blood cancer drug BENDEKA (March 28, 2016)
    • Update: In a statement, the company said it does not expect any U.S. drug applications referencing Bendeka until December 2022 and no generic competitors to Treanda until 2022.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • EOLS

    Profit-taking pressures Evolus, down 18%

    • Investors & traders continue to bag profits on Evolus (EOLS -17.9%), down on more than triple normal volume. Shares have retraced over 35% since touching $39.50 on Wednesday.
    • The stock had rallied four-fold after a brief selloff triggered by the FDA's rejection of its marketing application for Botox competitor prabotulinumtoxinA. Investors jumped into the stock after learning that the rejection related to CMC issues, not safety or efficacy, an issue that should be readily addressable.
    • Previously: FDA rejects Evolus marketing application for prabotulinumtoxinA; shares halted (May 16)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM | 6 Comments
  • NETE

    Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2.55 PM (06/08/2018)

    • Gainers: NETE +18%. BILI +17%. IGLD +11%. IQ +9%. TRHC +7%.
    • Losers: IFON -11%. MVIS -10%. NCTY -9%. AMRH -8%. NINE -8%.

  • IMASF

    Inmarsat rejects takeover approach from EchoStar

    • UK-based Inmarsat (IMASF +38.9%) has rejected a takeover approach from EchoStar (SATS -1%) on grounds that the deal "significantly undervalued" the company.
    • Shares closed up 13.5% in London though foreign shares are moving sharply higher on OTC markets.
    • “The board remains highly confident in the independent strategy and prospects of Inmarsat," the company says in a statement where it said the proposal didn't properly value Inmarsat's stand-alone prospects.
    • EchoStar's approach was preliminary and nonbinding, but Inmarsat is waving it off just the same.
    • Previously: SES up, Europe satellite firms on move after FCC grants fleet expansion (Jun. 08 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM
  • SID

    Brazil resource names turn green; Petrobras, Eletrobras +2%

    • Most U.S.-traded Brazilian resources stocks have turned around from recent losses, as Brazil's central bank chief said the bank would offer up to $20B in currency swaps and ensure liquidity in the currency and interest rate markets.
    • In the green: SID +2.8%, VALE +0.5%, BAK +3.1%, GGB +2.9%, CIG +4.8%.
    • Also, J.P. Morgan weighed in with positive comments on the state of affairs in the country and expects accommodative monetary policy until H2 2019.
    • Petrobras (PBR +2.4%) is higher despite a downgrade to Neutral from Buy from UBS after the company recently reduced prices, which the firm says significantly hurt chances of successful selling its refining assets and exposed it to possible interference depending on the government's policy approach and macro conditions.
    • Even Eletrobras (EBR +1.7%) has pushed into the green despite ongoing setbacks to a privatization program that now seems almost certain to be left to the next government.
    • ETFs: EWZ, BRZU, BRF, EWZS, BZQ-OLD, BRAQ, UBR, BRAZ, DBBR, FBZ
     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM | 3 Comments
  • SDT

    Energy/Materials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 PM (06/08/2018)

    • Gainers: SDT +15%. OTC:ANW +6%. NXE +6%. SDR +5%.

  • ATUS

    Altice USA completes separation from parent, now Altice Europe

    • Altice USA (ATUS -1.1%) has completed its official separation from Dutch parent Altice (ALLVF -3.1%).
    • That's happened via an in-kind special distribution of Altice's 67.2% interest in the U.S. spin-off to its shareholders from its share premium reserve. Those shareholders get 0.4163 shares of Altice USA for every share of Altice.
    • Along with the move, parent Altice NV is changing its name to Altice Europe NV. Patrick Drahi will be executive director of the board at Altice Europe.
    • Meanwhile, the Altice USA board will consist of nine members, with Drahi serving as chairman. Also on the board will be Charles Stewart (co-president and chief financial officer of Altice USA) and Gerrit Jan Bakker (treasurer of Altice Europe).
     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM
  • SYNA

    Update: Synaptics +2% on potential Dialog Semi deal

    • Synaptics (NASDAQ:SYNA) spikes then falls then bumps up again on social media rumors regarding deal talks with Dialog Semiconductor (OTCPK:DLGNF).
    • Synaptics shares are currently up 0.8% to $42.91.
    • Update: Bloomberg sources confirm the talks about a potential combination. The exploratory talks might not lead to an agreement.
    • Dialog has struggled as Apple cut orders for its power-management chips and a Synaptics tie-up would give the company access to smartphone sensor, touch pad, and touch screen verticals.
    • Synaptics shares are now up 2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:16 PM

  • ESNT

    Essent Group made a Top Idea at Zelman; shares gain nearly 4%

    • No details are available, but Ivy Zelman and team are buying the bounce in mortgage insurer Essent Group (ESNT +3.9%), adding the name to their Top Idea basket.
    • At its low for the year in late April, Essent was down nearly 25%. Shares are now off about 12% YTYD.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM | 1 Comment
  • BCLI

    Brainstorm Cell files for $100M mixed shelf offering; shares down 4%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Brainstorm Cell Therapeutics (BCLI -4.1%) is down on below-average volume on the heels of its prospectus for a $100M mixed shelf offering.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM | 1 Comment
  • IBM

    U.S. debuts "world's fastest" supercomputer from IBM

    • The U.S. Department of Energy debuts its IBM (IBM +0.1%) supercomputer today that it says is the fastest in the world, beating a Chinese machine that’s held the top place for two years. A U.S. computer last held the top spot over six years ago.  
    • The supercomputer dubbed Summit can perform 200,000 trillion calculations/second, according to IBM, or 200 petaflops. That’s eight times more powerful than Cray’s (CRAY +1.3%) Titan supercomputer and nearly twice as fast as the peak speed for Chinese supercomputer Sunway TaihuLight.
    • Summit is housed at Oak Ridge National Laboratory in Tennessee (the same location as Titan), incorporates technology from Nvidia (NVDA -0.6%), and cost about $200M.
    • Summit’s uses will include applying machine learning to genetic data to find patterns for treatments for Alzheimer’s, heart disease, and opioid addiction and to study supernovas.
    • The next global ranking of the 500 fastest scientific computers comes on June 25. As of November, China held 202 of the spots compared to 143 for the United States.   
    • Previously: Cray, IBM up after DOE call for supercomputers (April 10)
    • Previously: Hewlett Packard Enterprise teams up for UK supercomputer project (April 16)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM | 106 Comments
  • PTE

    PolarityTE slips 5% on bearish Citron tweet

    • Thinly traded small cap PolarityTE (COOL -4.6%) is down on a 5x surge in volume on the heels of a bearish (what else) tweet from short-seller Citron Research.

  • MRKR

    Midday Gainers / Losers (06/08/2018)

    • Gainers: TPIV +71%. EDAP +63%. SVRA +30%. ACOR +19%. SFIX +15%. TTOO +13%. NFEC +13%. AZRX +13%. VSI +12%. ZYME +13%.

  • SGBAF

    SES up, Europe satellite firms on move after FCC grants fleet expansion

    • SES Global (OTCPK:SGBAF) is up 3.1% in OTC trading after getting an OK from the FCC to "significantly" expand its O3b satellite fleet in medium earth orbit.
    • That opens significant additional frequencies that SES will use to serve the U.S. market. A total of 26 new O3b satellites were authorized, adding to 16 already operational and in orbit.
    • “With the first 7 O3b mPOWER satellites, we will deliver a paradigm shift in performance, bandwidth and service," says CEO Steve Collar. "The FCC grant provides the platform to exponentially scale the network in response to surging demand for global data connectivity.”
    • UBS responded by upgrading SES to Buy from Neutral, and made the same move on Eutelsat (ETCMY -4.1%).
    • Inmarsat, meanwhile, is also up (OTCPK:IMASY +14%; OTCPK:IMASF +38.9%).
     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM
  • BMY

    NASH players in spotlight on Bristol-Myers Squibb interest

    • Buying has perked up in certain stocks with exposure to non-alcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH) after Bristol-Myers Squibb's (BMY +0.8%) business development chief Paul Biondi said that the company is "actively looking for acquisitions or license opportunities" in fibrotic diseases (per DealReporter).
    • Selected NASH-related tickers: (CBAY +0.2%)(ICPT +8.7%)(MDGL +3.3%)(VKTX -1.3%)(GALT +4.6%)(WVE +1%)(PFE +0.3%)(GILD)(IONS -3.8%)(OTCPK:GNFTF -1.5%)(REGN -0.9%)(ALNY +0.6%)(ASMB +6.7%)(CANF +0.4%)(DRRX +2%)(GLMD -5.3%)(IMRN -3.1%)(GEMP)(ENTA +3.9%)(ORMP +2.8%)(AGN +2%)(VBLT -1%)(SHPG -0.1%)(DRNA -5.5%)(HZNP +6.2%)(RGLS -2.6%)(TKPYY -0.4%)(NVO -2.4%)(NVS -0.5%)(CNAT -1.1%)(ARCT -2.8%)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM | 106 Comments
  • UBX

    Unity Biotechnolog up 5.2% post Q1 results

    • Unity Biotechnology (UBX +5.2%) reports Q1 with cash & equivalents of $62.75M (+759.6% Q/Q).
    • The increase in cash reflects $54.9M in proceeds from the first close of UNITY’s Series C convertible preferred stock financing, offset by $11.9M used in operations & $0.6M in payments related to deferred offering costs from the IPO.
    • R&D expenses were $13M (+85.7% Y/Y), the increase was attributable to an increase in personnel related expenses of $3.6M, sponsored research expenses of $1.5M & pre-clinical and start-up activity expenses of $0.9M for the Phase 1 clinical study of UBX0101.
    • G&A expenses were $3.5M (+66.7% Y/Y) the increase was due to $0.6M in personnel related expenses and $0.8M increase in professional service expenses in preparation for becoming a public company.
    • “The company filed first Investigational New Drug application and received clearance from FDA, and are now preparing to enroll the first patients in Phase 1 clinical trial evaluating UBX0101 in moderate to severe osteoarthritis of the knee.” said Keith Leonard, chairman & CEO.
    • Previously: Unity Biotechnology reports Q1 results (June 7)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:07 PM
  • ELOX

    Eloxx Pharma's ELX-02 shows encouraging action in preclinical CF studies; investors unmoved, shares down 11%

    • Investors appear unimpressed with preclinical data on Eloxx Pharmaceuticals' (ELOX -10.6%) lead candidate ELX-02 for the treatment of certain cystic fibrosis (CF) patients. The results were presented at the European Cystic Fibrosis Conference in Belgrade.
    • When tested on organoids (mass of cells/tissue resembling an organ) from CF patients with homozygous and compound heterozygous nonsense mutations, ELX-02 induced an increase in forskolin-induced swelling (FIS) (a surrogate for clinical response to the drug) in a dose-dependent manner. FIS has been shown to correlate with improvement in lung function as measured by FEV1 (amount of air that can be exhaled in one breath).
    • Other preclinical data, generated on Fisher Rat Thyroid cells, human bronchi epithelium cells and in a mouse model, showed potentially clinically relevant responses.
    • The company believes that small molecule ELX-02, an aminoglycoside antibiotic, can benefit CF patients who have nonsense mutations on the CFTR gene, representing ~13% of all CF sufferers, because it has a high "read-through" (transcription of nucleic acid sequence) for such mutations.
    • A Phase 2 clinical trial in CF patients with at least one mutation, called G542X, should launch later this year.
    • Selected CF-related tickers: (VRTX +2.1%)(PTI +0.5%)(VRNA +3.4%)(ABBV +0.5%)(GLPG -0.5%)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM | 1 Comment
  • HURC

    More on Hurco Companies Q2 results

    • Hurco Companies (HURC -2.6%) reported Q2 net sales growth of 21% Y/Y to $70.24M reflecting favorable impact from forex (8%).
    • Sales by geography: Americas $21.65M (+20% Y/Y), Europe $38.24M (+21% Y/Y) and Asia Pacific $10.53M (+22% Y/Y).
    • Q2 Margins: Gross declined by 189 bps to 27.4% and operating declined by 69 bps to 8.5%.
    • SG&A expenses increased 13.7% Y/Y to $13.32M, driven by unfavorable currency impacts.
    • Orders for Q2 increased by 26% Y/Y to $79.92M reflecting increased customer demand for Hurco and Takumi vertical milling machines in Germany and the United Kingdom, and also increased customer demand for machine tool components and accessories.
    • Orders by geography: Americas $20.87M (+13% Y/Y), Europe $46.08M (+41% Y/Y) and Asia Pacific $12.97M (+5% Y/Y).
    • Previously: Hurco reports Q2 results (June 8)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM
  • REV

  • WDAY

    Workday acquires talent agency platform

    • Workday (NYSE:WDAY) acquires talent agency platform Rallyteam for an undisclosed amount.
    • Rallyteam helps companies retain employees by matching talented workers with in-house opportunities. 
    • TechCrunch says Workday likely wants Rallyteam’s workers to bolster Workday’s machine learning efforts. 
    • Rallyteam was founded in 2013 and last fall raised $8.6M in a round led by Norwest Ventures with participation from Cornerstone OnDemand, Storm Ventures, and Wilson Sonsini. 
    • Workday shares are up 0.7% to $124.28. 
     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM
  • EGHSF

    Enghouse Systems up 3.9% post Q2 results

    • Enghouse Systems (OTCPK:EGHSF) reports Q2 revenue growth of 7.1% Y/Y to C$85.2M.
    • Segment revenue: Software licenses of C$24.7M (+3.8% Y/Y); Hosted and maintenance services C$43.9M (+10% Y/Y); Professional services C$14.5M (-2.7% Y/Y) & Hardware C$2.1M (+110% Y/Y).
    • Adj. EBITDA increased 110 bps to 29.8% & income from operating activities was C$24.7M (+12.8% Y/Y).
    • The company approved its quarterly dividend of C$0.18 per common share.
    • CFO was C$21.8M (+18.5% Y/Y) & cash & equivalents of C$145.6M.
    • Previously: Enghouse Systems reports Q2 results (June 7)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM | 1 Comment
  • SGH

    SMART Global Holdings -9.4% on Brazilian real struggles

    • Brazil-focused DRAM company SMART Global Holdings (NASDAQ:SGH) plunges 9.4% due to the struggling Brazilian real.
    • Central bank intervention to support the real failed.
    • SMART shares are up 2% this week, 3.5% in the past month, and 35% YTD.       
    • Previously: Brazil banks tank as central bank intervention fails to prop up real (June 7)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM | 4 Comments
  • QCOM

    Qualcomm extends tender offer for NXP, tendered shares drop

    • Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM) again extends its tender offer from NXP Semiconductors (NASDAQ:NXPI). The new expiration date is June 15.
    • The tendered shares count stands at about 17.7M or 5.1% of the outstanding NXP shares, down from the 16.2% and the 13.1% tendered as of the last extensions. 
    • Qualcomm shares are down 0.5% to $60.34. 
    • NXP shares are down 0.2% to $119.84.       
    • Previously: Qualcomm extends NXP tender to May 25; tendered shares drop (May 11)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM | 43 Comments
  • DARE

    Daré Bio trying to clear near-term consolidation, up 14%

    • Nano cap Daré Bioscience (DARE +13.6%) broke through the $1.50 high of a six-week base in early trade but is struggling to maintain the breakout. Shares are now exchanging hands at $1.50, down 9% from the intraday high of $1.65.
    • Shares initially rallied in late April on the news that the company secured exclusive rights to Juniper Pharmaceuticals' contraceptive intravaginal ring technology. In mid-May, it launched a study evaluating its own contraceptive vaginal ring, Ovaprene, for post-coital use.
    • In early May, it announced a merger with Pear Tree Pharmaceuticals aimed at gaining ownership of PT-101, a vaginal formulation of tamoxifen for the potential treatment of vulvar and vaginal atrophy in certain breast cancer patients.
    • On the financial front, at the end of March it had $15.6M in cash and equivalents while operations consumed $2.1M in Q1.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM | 2 Comments

    Acorda adds to rally, up 24%

    • Thinly traded Acorda Therapeutics (ACOR +23.8%) is up again on almost a 6x surge in volume. Shares have rallied 50% since May 23.

  • AMD

    AMD +1.4% on The Information report about Intel battle

    • Advanced Micro Devices (NASDAQ:AMD) gains on a The Information report about how Intel’s (INTC -1.3%) manufacturing glitch opens the way for AMD to become first to market with a new, advanced chip.
    • Intel announced in April that the mass production of its 10nm Cannon Lake chips would receive another delay that would push the release back from the end of this year to 2019. 
    • AMD shares are up 1.4% to $15.10.  
    • Previously: AMD +5.5% after 7nm GPU unveil, Nvidia CEO comments (June 6)
    • Previously: Intel erases post-earnings gains, delays Cannon Lake again (April 27)

  • VISI

    Volt Information Sciences up 2% post Q2 results

    • Volt Information Sciences (VISI +1.7%) reports Q2 revenue decrease of 13.1% Y/Y to $263.2M.
    • Segment revenue: North American Staffing of $218.1M (-6.7% Y/Y); International Staffing $31.9M (+5.6% Y/Y); Corporate and Other $14.2M (-64.9% Y/Y).
    • On a same-store basis, net revenue declined 7.8% Y/Y, excluding net revenue contributed from businesses sold or exited during the past year and the effect of currency fluctuations.
    • Selling, administrative & other operating costs of $42.9M (-16.1% Y/Y) & Adjusted EBITDA -$3.7M, up $1.8M Y/Y.
    • Global liquidity of $59.4M, up $3.5M Y/Y; Total outstanding debt of $50M, down $40M Y/Y.
    • The Company announced that President and CEO Michael Dean left the Company & also announced that Linda Perneau was appointed Interim Chief Executive Officer, in addition to her role as President of Volt Workforce Solutions.
    • Previously: Volt Information Sciences reports Q2 results (June 7)

    Buyout chatter lifts Intercept Pharma more than 6%

    • Dealreporter is talking about Bristol-Myers Squibb (BMY +0.3%) having interest in purchasing Intercept Pharmaceuticals (ICPT +6.2%).
    • Update at 10:25 ET via Bloomberg: Dealreporter reports BMY business development chief Paul Biondi as saying his company is actively looking for acquisition or license opportunities in fibrotic diseases. Also on the move are Madrigal Pharma (MDGL +4.8%), Viking Therapeutics (VKTX +1.7%), Reata Pharma (RETA +1%), Galapagos (GLPG +0.2%), and FibroGen (FGEN +1.8%).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM | 14 Comments
  • CPST

    Capstone Turbine down 8% post Q4 results

    • Capstone Turbine (CPST -8.8%) reported Q4 revenue of $21.1M (-7.9% Y/Y). Segment revenues: Microturbine products $11.5M (-24.3% Y/Y) and accessories parts & services $9.6M (+23.1% Y/Y).
    • Q4 gross margin improved by 1,340 bps to 23%, the highest in the company history.
    • Q4 expenses: R&D $0.8M (-27.27% Y/Y) and SG&A $5.8M (+13.7% Y/Y).
    • Company recorded Q4 aftermarket gross margin of ~45% for accessories, parts & services segments, which helped cover 77% of the company’s operating expenses.
    • Company reported a positive Adj. EBITDA of $0.1M in contrast to year-ago EBITDA loss of $3.5M.
    • Cash from operating activities was $500K.
    • Q4 product order book-to-bill ratio was 1.4:1, strongest in last 4 years and Backlog was ~$97.3M as of March 31, 2018.
    • Previously: Capstone Turbine beats by $0.02, misses on revenue (June 7)
    • Slides
     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM | 9 Comments
  • CPST

    Capstone Turbine -8% after incomplete quarterly results

    • Capstone Turbine (CPST -8.8%) tumbles in early trade after reporting a $0.20 FY 2018 loss vs. a $0.79 loss in the prior year, with revenues +7% Y/Y to nearly $83M, but the company does not issue earnings or revenue results for the latest quarter.
    • Among FQ4 highlights that are presented: 23% total gross margin is highest in company history, 1.4:1 book-to-bill ratio is the strongest since Q2 2014, and adjusted EBITDA came in positive for the second straight quarter.
    • Adjusted EBITDA for FY 2018 was -$5.2M, or a $0.10/share loss, vs. year-ago adjusted EBITDA of -$21.9M, or a $0.68/share loss.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
  • DOVA

    Another insider buy at Dova Pharma; shares up 3.3%

    • Board member Paul Manning this week purchased 27K shares at an average price of $27.78 each. The buys totaled $767K and boosted his holdings by 0.2%.
    • Full insider history and performance statistics/past trades by Paul Manning are available at InsiderInsights.
    • DOVA +3.3% today to $28.08
    • Previously: Dova Pharma up another 8% as insiders buy (June 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM
  • AAPL

    Tech sector under pressure from Apple suppliers, semi equipment stocks

    • Semiconductor stocks and Apple (AAPL -1.6%) suppliers are pulling the tech industry down on today’s open after Broadcom’s (AVGO -2.1%), TSMC’s (TSM -1.8%) May revenue report, and a report that Apple could drop supplier orders by 20%. Semiconductor equipment makers remain pressured from yesterday’s analyst comment about memory push-outs.
    • The Philadelphia Semiconductor Index is down 1% and the sector (NYSEARCA:XLK) is down 0.5%.
    • Apple suppliers on the move: Cirrus Logic (CRUS -2.8%), Finisar (FNSR -3%), II-VI (IIVI +0.9%), Lumentum (LITE -5.4%), Qorvo (QRVO -1.4%), Skyworks Solutions (SWKS -2.5%), STMicroelectronics (STM -1.1%), Universal Display (OLED -2.2%).

  • AAPL

    NAR: Apple drops iPhone parts orders by 20%; supplier stocks dip

    • Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) has warned suppliers of a 20% drop in new orders for iPhone parts, according to Nikkei Asian Review sources.
    • NAR’s source: "Apple is quite conservative in terms of placing new orders for upcoming iPhones this year. For the three new models specifically, the total planned capacity could be up to 20% fewer than last year's orders."
    • Last year, Apple placed orders to prepare 100M production units of the iPhone 8 models and the iPhone X. Sources say Apple expects 80M total shipments of the new iPhones.
    • Total iPhone shipments dropped 1% Y/Y in the December quarter to 77.31M. Global smartphone shipments declined 0.3% to 1.46B units last year for the first-ever industry decline, according to IDC data.
    • Apple suppliers that could move on the news:  Broadcom (NASDAQ:AVGO), Cirrus Logic (NASDAQ:CRUS), Finisar (NASDAQ:FNSR), II-VI (NASDAQ:IIVI), Lumentum (NASDAQ:LITE), Qorvo (NASDAQ:QRVO), Skyworks Solutions (NASDAQ:SWKS), STMicroelectronics (NYSE:STM), Universal Display (NASDAQ:OLED).

  • TSM

    TSMC -2.6% on soft May revenue

    • Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. (NYSE:TSM) reports $2.72B in revenue from May 2018, down 1.1% on the month but up 11.2% Y/Y.
    • TSMC expects revenue of $7.8B to $7.9B in Q2, down 7% to 8% Q/Q. 
    • TSMC’s cumulative 2018 revenue through May totaled $13.7B, up 13% Y/Y. 
    • The company cut its 2018 forecast to a 10% growth from 10% to 15% at the most recent investors meeting due to weaker smartphone demand and growing cryptocurrency uncertainty. 
    • In other TSMC news, the company is accelerating mass production of its 7nm process technology to meet increasing demand and says major fabless clients like Qualcomm plan to skip 10nm to go directly to 7nm. 
    • Volume production now moves to Q2 and the foundry expects sales from the node to account for over 20% of revenue in Q4 and 10% for the year. 
    • Taiwan Semi shares are down 2.6% premarket to $38.50.  
    • Previously: Bloomberg: TSMC mass producing 7nm chips for Apple's iPhones (May 23)
